column2: SeEkas, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: While I can't comment on the effectiveness or satisfaction yet (I've only been on it for 2 weeks), I CAN comment on the side effects.  I have been experiencing extreme low back pain...from hip to hip and very tender to the touch. The other sore muscle areas on my body are my upper back, my chest, and the beginnings of my forearms.  I already have RA and have tested positive repeatedly for Lupus LAC, I have vascular disease too, but I know how I feel with all those.  The side effects from the Crestor is totally different.  I called my Dr, and she now wants to switch me to Livalo.  I'll try it, but from what I've read up on that drug, it's just as bad!

column2: Spencerfg, 65-74 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I've been taking this medication for a number of years and it seems to be reasonably effective in reducing cholesterol.  Unfortunately this comes with unacceptable side effects.  I've confirmed this by reducing dosage from 30mg/day to 0 over a period of time and then resuming it.  Lethargy, dizziness, muscle pain, arthritis, and sleeplessness all seem to be related to the drug.  Unfortunately, I did not associate these symptoms with the drug until recently.  I and my caregivers thought I was suffering from depression but treatment with various anti-depressants was ineffective.  I eventually retired from my job because I was having trouble getting through the day.  I can not continue with this medication.

column2: CC., 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I am on Crestor and have horrible side effects. I had a heart attack in 2008,i was 48 at the time, fit slim and healthy and had never taken any sort of medication in all my 48 years. After having the heart attack i was prescribed Crestor. Everything went downhill from there on. I am experiencing severe leg/calf toe and foot cramping. It started at night but now im having trouble walking, as my legs feel like they are bruised and cannot carry me. My arms feel like jelly. I have no strength and all day/night pain. My hips ache, im fatigued and all this is due to Crestor. This horrible horrible drug which reduces your cholesterol levels instantly, but harms your body.My muscles feel like they are collapsing as i can hardly lift anything. I was on 20mg of Crestor and now am on 5mg but i will be stopping it as my body feels like its shutting down.

column2: Chuck, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I was prescribed Crestor by my cardiologist after having CABGx3 on 7/28/2011. I had been on Zocor previously and my cholesterol had dropped from 180 to 111. Now the doctors want people to have their cholesterol level around 80, which seems a ridiculous low level to achieve. Since switching to Crestor I have experienced many, many muscle cramps, from my hips, my rib cage muscles, chest muscles, side muscles, feet, shoulder muscles and even under my chin around the larynx area. Talked to my cardiologist about it, who is also taking Crestor he says, but without the side effects I am experiencing. Told me to go off it for a week to let it flush out of my system and see how I felt. I felt much, much better without it. I was able to flex and stress my muscles more without worrying about all the cramping. Went back on it and VOILA! muscle cramps are back. A nurse at the hospital I go to for all my cardiology help told me that Crestor is one of the worst drugs so far as the way it effects your muscles. Said HER doctor had put her on Crestor, but she won't take it. I feel I have no choice as I have inherited atherosclerosis (clogging of the arteries) from my fathers side of the family, a definite family history of this disease. I feel I am destined to live with these horrible muscle cramps for the rest of my life. I was told I might be able to use Lipitor, but will have to wait for the generic price to come down as I can not afford what it presently costs. I dread finding out what the long-term effects of this drug are on the body.

column2: nyrsbigr, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: experiencing allot of unwanted muscle pain/joint pain since taking drug for over a year...last blood test showed cholesterol has stabilized in the normal range...unfortunately at a price.A lot of people i no has quit taking it.

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
Jasper1930
column9: Was placed on Crestor by my MD because simvastatin was not compatible with meds I use. Was using it for a few months and during that period I was getting weaker in my legs and arms. I continued to lose strength. I was very concerned. One day I listened closely to their TV commercial. In it they stated that a rare disease may cause muscle weakness and pain. I had those syptoms. Of all the muscles in the body the most important is the heart. My heart became more irradic and my pacemaker was working hard to correct the problem.     So I stopped taking Crestor on my own. Within one week without it I began to feel stronger, my heart rate returned to normal and I no longer had anxiety. I continued to improve daily and withing two months I was fine. My MD told me not to take it again and I haven't. I hope this has been helpful.

column2: moreat, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I know there's a lot of controversy about this drug but it lowered my cholesterol from 224 to 117, my triglycerides from 121 to 96, my LDL from 156 to 51, and raised my HDL from 44 to 47....ALL IN 3 WEEKS! No aching muscles, no back breaking pain in my lower back - which I've had with other meds for this problem.  I've had some itching and flushing but not bad.  I have had some severe dizzy spells but sinus problems could be an aggravating factor in that side effect.  All in all, I like it.

column2: HDMark2, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: This was no different than other statins I tried. My numbers were not overly high but they wanted me on this due to a 50% blocked artery. Got all the side effects listed previously in only 48 hours!! Pain so bad I could not stand straight. I used simple natural items instead and got the bad numbers down and the good numbers up! 90% of chest tightness gone too. And NO side effects! Found there are currently class action lawsuits listed online against Crestor. I know over 100 people that were/are on statins and I can count on one hand those that had little to no side effects. I was on 3 brands with Crestor being the worse. If your doctor insists you "wait it out", get a second opinion from a different source. For me the very slight benefits were wasted on the lack of life quality.

column2: 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: severe water retention and constipation

column2: 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Never again.  Like many, I developed horrible cramps and muscle pain to the point I couldn't function on a day to day basis.  Plus, it lowered my HDLs down to the risk level.  So, I took myself off the medication and it took weeks before I was nearly back to normal.  Months later, I do wonder if I have some permanent damage.I have learned many things since then.  I was always told by Doctors don't eat after midnight for a cholesterol test. I would snack late into the night, but always stopped at midnight. I always had my blood taken first thing in morning so I could eat breakfast later.  I have since found out one should fast 10 - 12 hours at a minimum, and certain foods will impact the test if eaten within 24 hours.After I did the "no eating after midnight fast", my total cholesterol was near 300...very high.  Again my PA wanted to put me on another Statin.  I said No.  After reading this website and others, I waited a couple of weeks for a second test.  This time, I just ate fruit, oatmeal and veggie soup then fasted 12 hours.  My total cholesterol dropped to 224 and all of my numbers were near optimal except my LDLs.  Since I don't have a genetic propensity for high cholesterol, I decided to make some lifestyle changes to get where I need to be.  Plus, even with an elevated LDL, other tests suggest my lifestyle makes up for my slightly elevated LDLs.I wonder how many people are being prescribed Crestor due to improper testing.  The upside, it forced me to become even more responsible for my health; don't take doctors/PAs opinion or lab results as the gospel (my mistake), and I have improved my diet and lifestyle because I never want to take crestor or another statin again.I hope my horrible experience with Crestor will help you.

I am exhausted and depressed (probably from not sleeping well and being so inactived due to the pain) I need to make an appointment for the MD but honestly I do not have confidience that he will not want to put me on a different Statin "since the outcome out weighs the side effects" NOT if it's your life! column2: risoundman, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I was prescribed Crestor almost a year ago. I take 10 mg at bedtime. When I first started taking i noticed slight headaches and some nasuea at first but kept taking it. After a year I have not had any issues. I have maintained a low fat healthy diet and excercise regularly as cautioned to by my doctor. My cholesterol profile is excellent now and I intend to keep taking the crestor. I understand people have bad reactions to drugs but not everyone does and judgements should not be made by reading just a few comments. I almost DIDNT take it because of what I read here. Im glad common sense prevailed and I did. Remember this...there are tens of thousdands of scripts written for any given drug every year and in comparison to that there are only a few bad comments here. My sympathies to those that did have trouble. I hope you were able to find a treatment that worked for you.

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: my cholestrol went from 337 to 157 in 6 weeks!

column2: ritascooper, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I have been taking Crestor for three years and find it to be very active in lowering my Cholesterol. I have had no side effects nor any sign of side effects from this medication. I have told my friends about Crestor...the ones who are taking Crestor are happy with the results. Anyone else I have told about Crestor has not given me any indication they are or have been unhappy with the medication.

column1: Combined High Blood Cholesterol and Triglyceride Level
column2: 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I started on Lipator in 2006 but stopped after 2 months due to severe muscle cramps. It took 30 days for cramps to subside. I then started taking 5mg Crestor. I have been taking Crestor for 5 years now with out any side effects. It lowered my total cholestrol from 230 to 130. My wife has been taking Crestor 10mg for the past 2 years without any side effects. It lowered her cholestrol also by 100 points.

column1: A Type of Inherited High Blood Cholesterol Disorder
column2: 2044 1978, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: This drug does do what it's labeled to do. The various changes to me over the last 10 months include increased general aches and pains that I can't unequivocally relate to Crestor.

column1: A Type of Inherited High Blood Cholesterol Disorder
column2: Rita, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have been taking Crestor for 2 mos.,& my chol. levels have gone down significantly. Before taking this, I lost 30 lbs, and was on Zocor, & my levels went UP! So far, the only side effects I have noticed are trouble sleeping and at times attacks of nausea, and fatigue. After reading the reviews, it is scary & if I even begin to have any muscle/joint pain, I will go off of it. I've been told my type of high cholesterol is hereditary, and diet & exercise do not do a thing to change my levels, which proved true. My Mom is 85 & has had her levels over 350 at times for YEARS! But who cares what your numbers are if you can live to 85 or older. We all have to die of something! I will continue to take Crestor until I experience any more side effects, at which point I will weigh the risks with the benefits I guess!

column9: Do you have to take Crestor at night for it to be effective? I take all my medicines in the a.m. I am afraid I will forget to take this at night. Since heart attack on July 6, 2011 I have been taking Crestor in a.m. since home from the hospital. Thanks!

column2: kathygem, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: this medicine was scarey for me to take at first due to all the negative feedback and i have MS and Fibromylgia so was scared I wouldnt be able to tell the difference if I did have side effects doctor first tried 10mg it took my total from 223 to 126 my ldl from 131 to 70 and the rest of my numbers were great but I wanted to be dropped down to 5mg to try so thats where Im at. They said if you are having side effects from the crestor it would happen within the first two weeks and that every statin carries risks but the benefits outweigh them.
